Package fr.uge.net.tcp.nonblocking.reader

Class StringReader

java.lang.Object
fr.uge.net.tcp.nonblocking.reader.StringReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Reader<java.lang.String>
public class StringReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements Reader<java.lang.String>
The reader can process a buffer to extract an integer (the length of the message) followed by a string encoded in UTF-8 with the given length. Like so: 
   integer   string (utf-8)
 ----------------------------
 | length |     message     |
 ----------------------------

The length of the message cannot be greater than ChatOSUtils.TEXT_SIZE. The method process(ByteBuffer) can be used to read a message until it returns Reader.ProcessStatus.DONE. After that, a call to get() will return the processed message. If you want to reuse this reader to process a new message you need to call reset(). Use examples: 
 var buffer = ByteBuffer.allocate(9)
                        .putInt(5)
                        .put(
                            StandardCharsets.UTF_8.encode("hello")
                        );
 var reader = new StringReader();
 reader.process(buffer);              // Return ProcessStatus.DONE
 var message = reader.get();          // message = "hello"
 reader.reset();
 buffer.clear().putInt(1);
 reader.process(buffer);              // Return ProcessStatus.REFILL
 buffer.clear().put((byte) 97);
 reader.process(buffer);              // Return ProcessStatus.DONE
 message = reader.get();              // message = "a"

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • process

      public Reader.ProcessStatus process​(java.nio.ByteBuffer bb)
      Processes the buffer and extracts the length (integer) and the message (encoded in UTF-8). This method remembers what has been processed beforehand. The returned value can be :
      • Reader.ProcessStatus.REFILL : if the reader has not finished.
      • Reader.ProcessStatus.ERROR : if the length of the message is not between 1 and ChatOSUtils.TEXT_SIZE.
      • Reader.ProcessStatus.DONE : if the message is ready to be get.
      Specified by:
      process in interface Reader<java.lang.String>
      Parameters:
      bb - the buffer where to read the data. Must be in write-mode before being called and will be kept in write-mode after.
      Returns:
      the current state of the reader.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the buffer's state is not Reader.ProcessStatus.REFILL.
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if bb is null.

    • get

      public java.lang.String get()
      Specified by:
      get in interface Reader<java.lang.String>
      Returns:
      the message if the process method has successfully read a message.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the process method hasn't finished to read a message.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the reader to its initial state. (This is equivalent to create a new StringReader without the allocation of a ByteBuffer)
      Note that the message will not be accessible with get() until process(ByteBuffer) have returned Reader.ProcessStatus.DONE once again.
      Specified by:
      reset in interface Reader<java.lang.String>
